question: Formula 1: Will Lewis Hamilton finish ahead of Max Verstappen in the Abu Dhabi Grand Prix?
description:
This is a market on whether Lewis Hamilton will finish ahead of Max Verstappen in the Formula 1 Abu Dhabi Grand Prix 2021, scheduled to take place on December 12, 2021. 

The last race of the season will be the title decider between both drivers, as they enter this Grand Prix level on 369.5 points.

The market will resolve to “Yes” If Lewis Hamilton finishes ahead of Max Verstappen, and “No” otherwise. 

If for any reason the Abu Dhabi Grand Prix is rescheduled to a date on or before December 31, 2021, the same market conditions will apply. 

If the Abu Dhabi Grand Prix is rescheduled to a date after December 31, 2021, the market will resolve 50-50. 

- If Lewis Hamilton finishes the race but Max Verstappen does not, or does not compete at all, the market will resolve to “Yes.” 
- If Max Verstappen finishes the race but Lewis Hamilton does not, or does not compete at all, the market will resolve to “No.” 
- If neither Lewis Hamilton nor Max Verstappen finish the race, then the market will resolve to 50-50.

question: NFL: Will the Buccaneers beat the Bills by more than 3.5 points in their December 12 matchup?
description:
In the upcoming NFL game, scheduled for December 12:

If the Tampa Bay Buccaneers win by over 3.5 points, the market will resolve to “Yes”.

question: Will the Polygon ($MATIC) Market Cap be above $15 billion on December 25?
description:
This is a market on whether Polygon ($MATIC) will have a market cap higher than $15 billion on the resolution time of December 25, 2021, 11:59 AM ET. 

This market will resolve to “Yes” if Polygon ($MATIC) has a market cap larger than 15,000,000,000.00 dollars, and “No” otherwise. 

The resolution source for this market will be the market cap on Coinmarketcap’s respective listings for Polygon ($MATIC), https://coinmarketcap.com/currencies/polygon/, on the right hand side next to 'Market Cap.'

--------------------

Market Cap is the total market value of a cryptocurrency's circulating supply. It is analogous to the free-float capitalization in the stock market.

Market Cap = Current Price x Circulating Supply.
